result.execSummary:
The defendant Summer L LeFevre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are same as conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Pay $250 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain/maintain employment, schooling and/or community service, as determined by DOC.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No entering bars, taverns, liquor stores or related establishments. No association with drug users or distributors. No possession or use of drug paraphernalia or prescription medications, unless properly prescribed. No contact with co-actors. No contact with SR, JG, MC.

Comply with assessments and programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, including AODA, mental health and psychiatric assessment and recommendations. Comply with electronic monitoring as directed by DOC. Follow all Juvenile Court disposition orders.

timeConds.notes: Perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with non-profit agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Summer L LeFevre

12:00 PM Defendant Summer L LeFevre not in court. Nicholas Paul Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Order for Payment of fees, wanted to set repayment plan. State takes no position. Court will reschedule.
Hearing on July 22, 2020 at 11:50 am.
for Payment of Fees - Copy mailed to Summer LeFevre 5/11/2020 lw

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough. Per Court, approved. May attend wake on the 11th, to return to jail on the 11th. May attend funeral on the 12th, to return on the 12th.
from Defendant requesting good time. Per Court, no good time on conditional jail time on probation case.
in support of Defendant

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. Court reviews correspondence received prior to hearing. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Defendant's father, husband make statements. Court makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with prior conviction that makes her second and subsequent offender. Defense requests PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant would like case set for plea hearing, PSI will be requested.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense needs time to review discovery with Defendant, requests 45-60 day adjournment. State will keep offer open until next Court appearance. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
from Dennis LeFevre requesting vehicle be returned. Per Court, I have had no involvement nor issued any Orders regarding impoundment of this car. Suggest you inquire at DA and/or Sheriff's office.
(rec'd by Court 9/11/15) from Defense requesting rescheduling
Status conference at 11-09-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Ray Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is very ill, advises that case is complicated, requests continuance. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
by Jessica Kreil
Defense presents argument for signature bond. State presents argument against reduction of bond. Court makes statement, denies motion.

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Defendant Summer L LeFevre in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Conditions remain the same.

Defense presents argument for reduction of bond. State presents argument against modification of bond. Court reduces bond to $1500 cash. Defense requests surety bond. Court advises that surety would have to be substantially more than $1500 (close to 3 times the value, something that can be liquidated quickly), would have to approved by Court.
by State

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Defendant Summer L LeFevre in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Defense requests that arraignment be scheduled.  Arraignment scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Defense presents argument for reduced bond. Court will consider motion if renewed at prelim.

Defendant Summer L LeFevre in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Defendant Summer L LeFevre in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense requests prelim within time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
by Defendant

Defendant was fingerprinted on 5/14/15.

No contact direct or indirect with JG. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed, including drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed.

Defendant Summer L LeFevre appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 5/27/15, 11:15.
